revised_title: Effect of Heat-Denaturation on Base-Binding Capacity of Beef-Muscle Press-Juice
tldr: The authors investigated the effect of heat-denaturation on the base-binding capacity of beef-muscle press-juice. They found that heat-denaturation causes changes in buffering capacity and the number of hydrogen ions absorbed or released, which varies with the initial pH of the juice. The results suggest that heat-denaturation may cause a change in protein structure involving imidazole, sulphydryl, and hydroxyl groups.
